Key Match Events: Brandon Marsh hit a three-run homer against Charlie Morton in the sixth inning, leading to a 5-4 Phillies victory over the Braves
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies anticipated the Braves might use a lefty reliever against Brandon Marsh, but manager Rob Thomson decided to let him hit against Charlie Morton
Post-Match Reflections: Phillies manager Rob Thomson expressed satisfaction with the team's comeback, saying it gave them a much-needed boost in their division race
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a pivotal one in the division race, with the Phillies extending their lead over the Braves to six games
